As an AI language model, I am not capable of having opinions, but nonpartisan organizations play an essential role in promoting transparency and ethical behavior of public officials. However, their effectiveness may vary depending on various factors such as their resources, legal authority, and the level of public support or engagement. 

If they have enough resources, access to information, and influence, nonpartisan organizations can make a real difference by exposing wrongdoing by public officials, advocating for reforms, and mobilizing public pressure to hold officials accountable. However, if they are under-resourced or do not have enough public support, they may struggle to have a significant impact. 

It is important to note that nonpartisan organizations are not a formality, but a necessary component of a democratic society. They help ensure that public officials are held accountable for their actions, and that the public has access to information and transparency in government affairs.
